clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Evaluation of ABX464 in Patients With Moderate to Severe Active Crohn's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2a, Randomized, Parallel-group, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety of ABX464 Compared With Placebo in Patients With Moderate to Severe Active Crohn's Disease Who Have Inadequate Response, Loss of Response, or Intolerance to Prior Amino-salicylates, Immunosuppressant Treatment, Biologics, and/or Corticosteroid Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase IIa study is a 16-week, double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized study aiming at evaluating the safety and the efficacy of ABX464 given once a day (o.d) at 50 mg in subjects with moderate to severe active Crohn's Disease who have inadequate response, loss of response, or intolerance to prior amino-salicylates, immunosuppressant treatment, biologics, and/or corticosteroid treatment, and followed by a 4 weeks period of follow-up after the last study drug intake.

detailed_description.textblock:
This Phase 2a study is a 16-week, double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized study aiming at evaluating the safety and the efficacy of ABX464 given once a day (o.d) at 50 mg in subjects with moderate to severe active Crohn's Disease who have inadequate response, loss of response, or intolerance to prior amino-salicylates, immunosuppressant treatment, biologics, and/or corticosteroid treatment, and followed by a 4 weeks period of follow-up after the last study drug intake.
Eligible patients will be randomized according to a 2/1 ratio in two different groups of treatment : ABX464 50mg OR placebo.
After the treatment phase at week 16, all randomized patients willing to continue with the study treatment will have the possibility to enter a separate open-label study. In that case, patients will stop their participation after week 16, otherwise they will go through the 4 weeks follow-up period and the end of study visit will take place on week 20.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events of ABX464
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 16 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Number and rates of treatment-emergent adverse events in the ABX464 treated patients versus placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a clinical response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline, at week 8 and week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving at least a decrease of ≥100-point in Crohn's Disease Activity Index from baseline by treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a clinical remission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline, at week 8 and week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with clinical remission defined as a Crohn's Disease Activity Index below 150.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline, at week 8 and week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Time to achieve a decrease of ≥100-point in Crohn's Disease Activity Index from baseline by treatment group.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline, at week 8 and week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Time to achieve a Crohn's Disease Activity Index below 150 from baseline, by treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the effect of ABX464 50mg on Clinical Response and Remission assessed by 2-item Patient Reporting Outcome versus placebo;
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline, at week 8 and week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with Symptomatic Remission using the 2-item Patient Reporting Outcome by treatment group. (Symptomatic Remission is defined as: Stool frequency: (Weekly average over 7 days prior to visit) mean daily score ≤3; and abdominal pain: (Weekly average over 7 days prior to visit) mean daily score ≤1);)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with endoscopic response
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving at least a decrease of at least 50% in the Simple Endoscopic Score for Crohn's Disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with endoscopic remission
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with endoscopic remission define as Simple Endoscopic Score for Crohn's Disease <=3

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the effect of ABX464 on the histopathology of the Crohn's disease
secondary_outcome.description: Change from screening in the histopathology pattern of colon biopsies

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with both clinical response and endoscopic response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from screening/baseline, at week 8 and week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with both a decrease of ≥100-point in Crohn's Disease Activity Index from baseline AND an endoscopic response defined as a decrease of at least 50% in the Simple Endoscopic Score for Crohn's Disease by treatment group

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the effect of ABX464 50mg on C-reactive protein levels and fecal calprotectin at week 8 and week 16 versus placebo;
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline, at week 8 and week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change to baseline in C-reactive protein levels and fecal calprotectin by treatment group

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the effect of ABX464 50mg on patients' quality of life measured by Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline, at week 8 and week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Scores and changes in the Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire. This questionnaire has been validated and consists in 32 items to describe 4 different types of symptoms/manifestations related to: digestive symptoms, systemic symptoms, emotional disorders, social function. Patients evaluate their quality of life with a 7-point Likert type answering system. The global score (from 32 to 224) is obtained by the sum of each individual item score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of treatment-emergent serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 16 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment-emergent serious adverse events;

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of adverse events leading to investigational product discontinuation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 16 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of adverse events leading to investigational product discontinuation

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of the micro RNA-124 expression in whole blood and in tissue in the ABX464 treatment group vs placebo;
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of micro-RNA-124 expression in whole blood (PAXgene®) and in tissue (RNA later) in both group

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of ABX464 pharmacokinetics and its main active metabolite N-Glu-ABX464 after oral administration of a 50 mg dose of ABX464
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, week 4, week 12, week 16, end of study visit (week 20)
secondary_outcome.description: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of ABX464 and its main metabolite N-Glu ABX464 at pre-dose and post-dose.

intervention.description: ABX464 is a new anti-inflammatory drug. In the treatment arm, patients will receive 50 mg of ABX464 orally once daily during 112 days.
In the placebo group, patients will receive 50mg ABX464-matching-placebo orally once daily during 112 days.
